title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranks eighth in Patriots' history for best free-agent signings.
Williams contributed 5.5 sacks and quick pressures vital to Patriots' Super Bowl LX run.
He signed a four-year, $104 million contract, the largest in franchise history.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Boston Celtics are not expected to make major acquisitions before the NBA trade deadline.
Possible trade targets for the Celtics include Nets center Nic Claxton and Mavericks center Daniel Gafford.
Other candidates include Kings guard Keon Ellis and Pelicans center Yyves Missi, with various trade hurdles identified.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Something in the Way Fest 2026 at Boston's Roadrunner features indie and alternative rock bands over two days, January 31 and February 1.
Baltimore-based band Angel Du$t performed energetically, inciting crowd surfing and stage diving during their 45-minute set.
Brooklyn band Momma donated festival merchandise proceeds to the Immigrant Law Center of Minnesota, highlighting their political stance.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced under a tent at Raymond James Stadium in Tampa to maintain ice conditions for Sunday's game.
The tent, used to control temperature and humidity, measured 34 feet high, 125 feet wide, and 240 feet long.
Sunday's Stadium Series game may be colder than expected, with temperatures predicted in the 30s at puck drop.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands protested at Boston's 'ICE Out Everywhere' rally on Jan. 31, 2026, demanding stronger protections for immigrant communities.
The event, part of a nationwide campaign, was organized by local advocacy groups including Mass 50501 and UU Mass Action.
Protesters criticized ICE for recent deaths and called for ending state and local cooperation with the agency.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand protesters gathered at Boston Common on January 31 to oppose President Trump's immigration policies.
The protest, part of a nationwide series, was organized by Mass 50501 and other local groups.
Despite frigid 15-degree temperatures, participants rallied at the State House with music from Somerville's Good Trouble Brass Band.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: ESPN's Jeff Passan suggests the Red Sox might trade for infield help before the 2026 season starts.
Isaac Paredes and Christian Walker are potential targets, with a focus on improving infield defense.
The Red Sox explore trade options with Cubs and Astros, prioritizing defensive upgrades over power hitters.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots will face the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX after improving to a 14-3 record this season.
Drake Maye's father, Mark, expressed surprise at the Patriots' Super Bowl run following back-to-back 4-13 seasons.
Quarterback Drake Maye led NFL in completion percentage, yards per attempt, and passer rating during regular season.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth and Mike Tirico will call Super Bowl LX for NBC, marking Collinsworth's fourth Patriots broadcast this season.
Collinsworth has covered five Patriots Super Bowls, including a past matchup against the Seahawks 11 years ago.
Collinsworth praised the Patriots' adaptability, comparing their current strategy to past dynasty years under Bill Belichick.

title: Mass. snowplow driver who spotted legs sticking out of snowbank praised for saving older man
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts snowplow driver Matte McGarry rescued an elderly man stuck face-down in a snowbank in Auburn.
The incident occurred Sunday night during a snowstorm; the man fell into a 3-foot-deep snowbank after a Patriots game.
McGarry will receive commendation from the Auburn Board of Selectmen for his quick response during the rescue.
